com.mvohm.quadruple.test

Class DataItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mvohm.quadruple.test.DataItem

  • class DataItem
extends Object
    A DataItem is a container for a value used or generated when testing an operation with a data sample, such as an argument of the tested operation, the actual result of the performed operation, or the expected value of the result to compare the actual result with.
    DataItems with values or errors messages are used to collect statistics on test results and to print source test data and operation results to the console during the execution of the tests (if the test execution code works in a talkative mode).
    In most cases, a DataItem holds a BigDecimal value and the corresponding Quadruple value that is the best possible approximation of the BigDecimal value. Instead of it, it also may hold a value of a 'raw' type, that may be String, BigDecimal, Double, Integer, Long, or an array of longs or bytes. This capability is used when testing conversions from Quadruple to other types and from other types to Quadruple, to store the results or the input values, respectively.
    The value to store may be set using methods
    • withString(String)
    • withValueOfString(String),
    • withQuadValueOfString(String),
    • withValueOf(Object),
    • withQuadruple(Quadruple), or
    • withRawValue(Object).

    In case if an error occurs when testing, an appropriate error message may be set with methods withError(String) or withError(String, String).
    A string representation of the data item, intended to be displayed as a part of the output printed to the console during testing, can be obtained with toString() method.
    The values of specific fields can be obtained with getBDValue(), getQuadValue(), getRawData(), getStrValue() methods. The hasError() methods indicates if the DataItem contains an error message.
    Author:
    M.Vokhmentsev

      • withString

        Parameters:

      • withValueOfString

        public DataItem withValueOfString(String strValue)
        Parses the given String and assigns respective values to the fields of this instance.
        If the value expressed with the string can be represented as a BigDecimal value, assigns exactly this value to the bdValue field, otherwise, in case of NaN or Infinity, assigns a String representation of the value to the strValue field. Assigns the best possible Quadruple approximation of the exact input value to the quadValue field. Due to limited precision of Quadruple, this value may differ from the exact input value by no more than 1.469e-39.
        Unlike withQuadValueOfString(String), does not align the BigDecimal value to make it exactly equal to the value of the quadValue, but assigns to the bdValue field the exact value expressed with the input string.
        If the input string can't be parsed, puts a relevant error message to the errMsg field and the input string to the strValue field, leaving other fields empty (i.e. with null values).
        To be usable for DataItems with expected values, distinguish word "error" as an indication of the fact that the operation being tested, when applied to the given input data, was expected to cause an error (like for a priori illegal source strings when testing String to Quadruple conversion)
        Parameters:
        strValue - a String that's expected to signify the numeric value to be assigned
        Returns:
        this instance with the fields modified as described above
        See Also:
        withQuadValueOfString(String)

      • withQuadValueOfString

        public DataItem withQuadValueOfString(String strValue)
        Parses the given String and assigns the corresponding Quadruple value to the quadValue field. If the value can be represented as a BigDecimal value, assigns the corresponding BigDecimal value to the bdValue field, otherwise (e.g. "NaN" or "Infinity") assigns a String representation of the value to the strValue field. Unlike #withValueOfString(String), assigns to the bdValue field not the exact value expressed with the input string, but the exact value of the Quadruple value derived from it, that has a limited precision and may differ from the exact value by no more than 1.469e-39.
        If the input string can't be parsed, puts a relevant error message to the errMsg field and the input string to the strValue field, leaving other fields empty (i.e. with null values).
        To be usable for DataItems with expected values, distinguish word "error" as an indication of the fact that the operation being tested, when applied to the given input data, was expected to cause an error (like for a priori illegal source strings when testing String to Quadruple conversion)
        Parameters:
        strValue - a String that's expected to signify the numeric value to be assigned
        Returns:
        this instance with the fields modified as described above
        See Also:
        withValueOfString(String)

      • withValueOf

        public DataItem withValueOf(Object rawData)
        Sets the fields of the instance to reflect the value numerically equal to or closest to the value of the input parameter, that can be a BigDecomal, a String, a Double, a Long, or an Integer instance. Assigns the corresponding values to the quadValue and bdValue fields. In cases of values that can't be represented by a BigDecimal (like NaN or Infinity), instead of assigning to bdValue, assigns respective string designations to the strValue field. If the parameter is a String and it can't be parsed as a numeric value, the quadValue and bdValue remains empty and the errMsg field is assigned with a relevant error message. In this case, strValue field takes the value of the input string
        Parameters:
        rawData - the data whose value is to be assigned
        Returns:
        this instance with the fields modified as described above

      • withQuadruple

        public DataItem withQuadruple(Quadruple value)
        Fills the fields of the instance with values corresponding to the given Quadruple value.
        Assigns the given value to the quadValue field; if the value may be represented as a BigDecimal, additionally assigns the corresponding BigDecimal value to the bdValue field, otherwise (in case of NaN or Infinity) sets a String representation of the given value in the strValue field.
        Parameters:
        value - the Quadruple whose value is to be assigned to the fields of the instance
        Returns:
        this instance with the fields modified as described above

      • withRawValue

        public DataItem withRawValue(Object rawData)
        Assigns the given value, that may be of any type, to the rawData field of the instance. Used to hold and display source values of various types that are to be converted to Quadruple and results of converting Quadruple values to various other types.
        Parameters:
        rawData - the value to assign
        Returns:
        the same instance with the given value assigned to the rawData field

      • withError

        public DataItem withError(String errMsg)
        Sets the given error message, after prepending it with "Error: ", in the errMsg field.
        Parameters:
        errMsg - the message to set
        Returns:
        this instance with the errMsg field containing the error message

      • withError

        public DataItem withError(String errMsg,
                          String sourceStr)
        Sets the given error message, after prepending it with "Error: ", in the errMsg field. Additionally, sets the value of the sourceStr parameter in the strValue field
        Parameters:
        errMsg - the message to set in the errMsg field
        sourceStr - the string to set in the strValue field
        Returns:
        this instance with the errMsg field containing the error message and the strValue field containing the value of the sourceStr parameter

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string that designate the role of the item and represents the contents of the fields in a form suitable for printing to console when testing operations.
        If the item contains an error message, appends it to the role, preceding it with the contents of the source string value (if it's not empty), e.g. 
         val: '.e35': Error java.lang.NumberFormatException converting .e35 to a numeric value
        or 
         res: Error: java.lang.NumberFormatException: Can't convert POSITIVE_INFINITY to BigDecimal
             performing Quadruple.bigDecimalValue() on Infinity
        Otherwise, if the rawData field is not empty and not an array, returns the role along with a string form of the contents of the field, e.g. 
         src:  12345.0
        Otherwise, if the rawData field is an array, returns the role along the contents of the strValue field (that contains a string representation of the array in this case), e.g. 
         res:  59d3_8fae_383c_132b 6d14_f1b6_5e9c_6dcd
        Otherwise, builds a string from the role designation, a decimal representation of the BigDeciamal value from the bdValue field or a string representation of a value in case if the value is not valid for BigDecimal, and a hexadecimal representation of the Quadruple value from the quadValue field, e.g. 
         res:  1.2345000000000000000000000000000000000000000e+04        (+81c8_0000_0000_0000 0000_0000_0000_0000 e 8000_000c)
        or 
         res: Infinity                                                  (+0000_0000_0000_0000 0000_0000_0000_0000 e ffff_ffff)
        The hexadecimal representation of the Quadruple value consists of the sign and the hexadecimal forms of the mantHi and mantLo fields of the Quadruple instance, followed by the hexadecimal form of its exponent after the letter 'e'.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
